column4: Sorry... can anyone help with wireless not being recognised at all?
you can websearch from there, its a terminal command
you can copy / paste to / from the terminal
one line will identify the device, websearch for that
thats how linux sees your device, you may see it as a netgear pci adapter but thats just a plastic shell, you are driving the chip inside
if its a laptop make sure the device is enabled at the switch
is there an Fn + F key combo you can press to turn it on?
thats gotta suck for power if its uneeded
I found it... you need to restart after activating the Ibex-wrapped driver...
why buy expensive mac mac hardware to put linux on?
